oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Death of General Edward Pakenham scene
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Color engraving, "Death of General Packenham [sic]." Pakenham is shown falling mortally wounded from his horse. His troops surround him while a cannoneer kneels in front of an artillery piece. An American cannon fires from the rampart. From John Frost and W. Croome, "Pictorial Life of Andrew Jackson."
The 36-year-old commander of British army forces in North America was killed by American grapeshot during the Battle of New Orleans, January 8, 1815.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Pakenham, Edward Michael, 1778-1815
